definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: The lunar calendar in March twenty-three, is the county seat of the ancient traditional, huge crowds of people on the street.
sentences.chinese: 农历三月二十三，是县城传统古会，大街上人山人海。

sentences.english: So it's going to be very crowded and it's going to be very exciting.
sentences.chinese: 因此这里将会人山人海，而且会十分激动人心。

sentences.english: Here there were large, specially designed lanterns made a wide range of design, novelty.
sentences.chinese: 这里人山人海，花灯种类繁多，设计新奇，造型各异。

sentences.english: Are there really enough odd-numbered rooms to accommodate the teeming horde of new guests?
sentences.chinese: 双号房间真能足够排下人山人海的新客人吗？

sentences.english: There were thousands of people inside and very crowed. People moved very slowly.
sentences.chinese: 超市里人山人海，摩肩接踵，人们移动地非常缓慢。

sentences.english: There are still lots of people, so was hard to move in the exhibition hall.
sentences.chinese: 展览会场人山人海，人要移动都很困难。

sentences.english: A sea of faces, walking as well as being apt , waits being holding the ticket smile.
sentences.chinese: 人山人海，边走边爱，拿着车票微笑等待。

sentences.english: Huge crowds welcomed the torch parade.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎火炬的市民人山人海。

sentences.english: Indeed, this could soon become a crowded field.
sentences.chinese: 的确，这片研究领域很快会变得人山人海。
所以那里从不会人山人海。

definition: lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
crowded to bursting point/filled to overflowing/jam-packed
lit. not one drop can trickle through (idiom); fig. impenetrable (crowd, traffic)
the multitudes come out from everywhere, emptying every alleyway (to celebrate)/the whole town turns out
lit. a banquet with no empty seats/full house/capacity crowd/standing room only
to form a long queue (idiom)/(of cars) to be bumper to bumper
